item.title: 「Silent for Over 14 Years Holding 3963 BTC」 Whale Recently Sold 150 Bitcoins
item.description: On July 30th, according to EmberCN's monitoring, the "Dormant Whale" which had been holding 3963 BTC for more than 14 years woke up in the past few days and has been gradually selling through a market maker. The address, after emerging from dormancy, moved 450 BTC (approximately $53.42 million). Within the past 5 days, 150 BTC entered Coinbase and the associated addresses of market makers B2C2 and Wintermute. Currently, the address still holds 3678 BTC (approximately $434 million).

item.title: Libre Capital Rebrands to KAIO, Launches $100 Million Tokenized Revenue Fund
item.description: On July 30th, the RWA platform, Libre Capital, announced today that it is rebranding as KAIO. This marks a significant step for the company in linking traditional finance with the decentralized ecosystem by means of compliant institutional-grade tokenization.In conjunction with the rebranding, KAIO has launched the tokenized Laser Digital Bitcoin Diversified Yield Fund. This is a cryptocurrency-native solution designed to offer BTC holders an attractive, enhanced, and compliant yield.The fund, managed by Laser Digital Middle East, has received more than $100 million in capital commitments. This demonstrates the trust of institutional investors in the KAIO infrastructure, which seamlessly combines cryptocurrency-native yield with the strictness of traditional asset management.

item.title: US Department of Justice: Canadian Cybercriminal Sentenced to One Year in Jail for NFT Fraud
item.description: July 30: The U.S. Department of Justice made an announcement that a Canadian individual received a one-year prison sentence the previous day due to conspiracy to commit telecommunications fraud, telecommunications fraud, and conspiracy to commit aggravated identity theft.Based on court documents, 22-year-old Cameron Albert Redman devised a plan to steal non-fungible tokens (NFTs). He achieved this by illegally accessing the X accounts of multiple digital artists. Redman and his accomplices employed these artists' online identities to redirect their fans to a fraudulent website. On this website, the victims thought they were authorizing a transaction to have the NFTs transferred to their digital wallets, but in fact, they were unknowingly enabling the conspirators to steal cryptocurrency and NFTs from their wallets. It is reported that Cameron Albert Redman and his associates defrauded more than 200 victims and made a profit of over $794,000.

item.title: US Treasury Secretary: Fed Expected to Hold Rates Today, Fed Made Mistake on Inflation from Tariffs
item.description: On July 30th, U.S. Treasury Secretary Yellen expressed that she desires to witness the Federal Reserve possessing "a bit of imagination." She once again emphasized that the Fed made an error in evaluating the impact of tariffs on inflation. It is anticipated that the Fed will not reduce interest rates today. (FXStreet)

item.title: BlackRock's ETHA has increased its holdings by 1.25 million ETH this month, surpassing a total of 3 million ETH held.
item.description: On July 30th, as per the monitoring of lookonchain, starting from July 1st, BlackRock's ETH Trust has added an additional 1.25 million ETH. This is approximately worth $4.73 billion. Currently, its total holdings have surpassed 3 million ETH, with a total value of around $11.36 billion.

item.title: Publicly traded company Blockmate Ventures acquires an additional 1 BTC
item.description: On July 30, the publicly traded company Blockmate Ventures announced the acquisition of 1 Bitcoin. The funds for this acquisition originated from Blockmate's existing cash reserves, and the current holdings have reached 2 Bitcoins.

item.title: Telegram username '@crypto' receives a $25 million offer, with the price skyrocketing 70x in two years
item.description: On July 30th, Pavel Durov, the CEO of Telegram, stated in a post on Wednesday that an early user of Telegram and Toncoin (TON) had recently received a $25 million offer to purchase their "crypto" username on Telegram.The username was originally bought for $350,000 in 2023. The username holder also recently said, "If these cannot be taken away by others, then I want to own all rare usernames." - This is the quote that Durov referenced in the post.All usernames on Telegram are tokenized on the TON blockchain, meaning each username is unique and cannot be replicated. According to Statista data, the most expensive username in 2024 was @news, selling for as much as $5.8 million, while @auto also fetched a high price of $5.2 million.In the post, Durov wrote: "Miracles happen when people can directly own their digital assets - just like this tokenized Telegram username, which has increased in value by 70 times." "Telegram users are true sovereigns: no middlemen, no forced confiscation,

item.title: U.S. Treasury Secretary: Trade Negotiations Can Continue After August 1 If No Trade Agreement Is Reached
item.description: July 30th: Treasury Secretary Yellen of the U.S. said, "In the absence of an agreement, trade negotiations can proceed after August 1. I expect August to be quite busy as trade agreements still need to be reached."

item.title: LookOnChain: Ethereum Surges Above $3800
item.description: On July 30th, according to HTX market data, Ethereum saw a rebound and managed to break through $3800. It witnessed a 0.03% decrease in the past 24 hours.

item.title: LookOnChain: Bitcoin Surges Above $118,000
item.description: On July 30th, according to HTX market data, Bitcoin saw a rebound and surpassed $11,800. The 24-hour decline narrowed to 0.12%.
